profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: George William Norris (1875-1965) was a professor of clinical medicine at the University of Pennsylvania and chief of Medical Service "A" at Pennsylvania Hospital. He received his bachelor's degree from the University of Pennsylvania in 1895 and his M.D. in 1899. He served in World War I as a member of the Major Medical Corps in the Pennsylvania Hospital Unit. He was an amateur photographer.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes photographs and other materials related to Norris's work and career. There are two photograph albums that mainly feature family and friends and places associated with these people; there are also photos and printed materials related to travel in Haiti, Venezuela, and other locales. Many of the photographs were taken by Norris and include commentary from Norris. There is also an album of published(?) landscape photographs, as well as many portrait photographs by Norris. The collection includes one scrapbook of letters, photographs, certificates, awards, calling cards and other items (including a few photographs) and a narrative account of a trip to Guatemala in 1963.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
